title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says several spells of showers will occur in Northern and Eastern provinces.

title: CAA continues raids on rice traders across the island
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has announced that raids are continuing across the island to monitor rice traders and stocks.

title: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation commits to expanding support in Sri Lanka
byline: The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation has committed to expanding its initiatives in Sri Lanka, the President’s Media Division (PMD) stated.

title: Sri Lanka records nearly 1.9 million tourist arrivals in 2024
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) has reported that nearly 1.9 million tourists have visited the island so far this year.

title: Sri Lanka’s new Speaker to be appointed on Dec. 17?
byline: Political observers have stated that the appointment of a new Speaker to fill the vacancy left by the resignation of Asoka Ranwala should likely take place on December 17.

title: Landslide early warnings issued for several areas
byline: The National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings for multiple areas in several districts, as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Suspect arrested with stock of commercial explosives in Punewa
byline: A person has been arrested by the police while in possession of a stock of commercial explosives.

title: South Korea’s President faces second impeachment vote over martial law bid
byline: A defiant South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces a second impeachment vote on Saturday over his short-lived attempt to impose martial law, a move that shocked the country, split his party and imperilled his presidency half way through his term.

title: Over 300,000 Sri Lankans left for foreign employment in 2024
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) reports that in 2024, the number of Sri Lankans migrant workers who have travelled overseas for employment surpassed 300,000, reaching 300,162 as of December 13.

title: IOC and OCA cut funding to Sri Lanka’s National Olympic Committee
byline: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) and the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) have decided to suspend all payments to the National Olympic Committee of Sri Lanka.

title: President accepts Ashoka Ranwala’s resignation as Speaker
byline: The Presidential Secretary, Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake has officially informed the Secretary General of Parliament in writing that the President has accepted the resignation of Speaker Ashoka Ranwala.

title: South Korea’s parliament votes to impeach President over martial law order
byline: South Korea’s parliament voted Saturday to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol as authorities investigate allegations of rebellion over his controversial Dec. 3 martial law decree that has caused huge political turmoil in the country.

title: New online portal launched to verify legally imported vehicles
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has launched an investigation into the nearly 6,000 vehicles across Sri Lanka which have been fraudulently registered with the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT).

title: Woman injured in shooting near Maligakanda court
byline: One person has reportedly been injured following a shooting incident in the Maligakanda area this afternoon (14).
